lessons.Title: Operators and Expressions
lessons.Lesson: Operators perform operations on variables and values. Arithmetic operators include +, -, *, /, and %. Comparison operators include ==, ===, !=, !==, >, <, >=, <=. Logical operators include &&, ||, and !. Expressions are combinations of values, variables, and operators that produce a result. Understanding how operators and expressions work allows developers to implement logic in programs.

lessons.Title: Control Structures
lessons.Lesson: Control structures manage the flow of execution in JavaScript programs through if, else, switch, loops, and logical branching. They help create dynamic and responsive applications.

lessons.Title: Functions
lessons.Lesson: Functions are reusable blocks of code. JavaScript supports function declarations, expressions, and arrow functions. Functions improve code reusability and structure.

lessons.Title: Objects and Arrays
lessons.Lesson: Objects store data in key-value pairs, arrays store ordered lists. Understanding methods like map, filter, reduce is essential for data manipulation.

lessons.Title: Modules and Imports
lessons.Lesson: Modules help structure code. ES6 introduced import and export statements for modular JavaScript development.

quiz.question: Which data type stores multiple values?

lessons.Title: Introduction & Types
lessons.Lesson: TypeScript adds static typing to JavaScript, making applications more scalable and less error-prone.

lessons.Title: Interfaces & Types
lessons.Lesson: Interfaces define contracts for objects. Type aliases allow flexible reusable definitions.

lessons.Title: Functions & Generics
lessons.Lesson: Generics help create reusable and flexible components.

lessons.Title: Classes & OOP
lessons.Lesson: TypeScript supports OOP with classes, inheritance, and access modifiers.

lessons.Title: Decorators & Modules
lessons.Lesson: Decorators add metadata and enhance classes. Modules organize scalable apps.

lessons.Title: JSX & Components
lessons.Lesson: JSX blends JS with HTML-like syntax to build components.

lessons.Title: Props & State
lessons.Lesson: Props pass data. State manages component data dynamically.

lessons.Title: Hooks
lessons.Lesson: useState, useEffect, useRef make functional components powerful.

lessons.Title: Context API
lessons.Lesson: Used for global state management without prop drilling.

lessons.Title: Node Basics
lessons.Lesson: Node is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome V8.

lessons.Title: Modules
lessons.Lesson: CommonJS and ES Modules organize backend code.

lessons.Title: File System
lessons.Lesson: Perform file operations using fs module.

lessons.Title: Express.js
lessons.Lesson: Express helps create server APIs easily.

lessons.Title: Auth
lessons.Lesson: JWT authentication and hashing improve security.

lessons.Title: Documents & Collections
lessons.Lesson: MongoDB stores data in BSON documents.

lessons.Title: Deployment
lessons.Lesson: Use MongoDB Atlas for cloud hosting.

lessons.Title: Variables
lessons.Lesson: Python has dynamic typing and simple syntax.
